dialogues.GIGI:
[1]I have a theory about how this all started... 
[2]Uh - excuse me -- but what - the - HELL? Where did that rumor start? Because moms have been spreading it for years. 
[3]Do you understand what this means? We are all encouraged to believe that if a guy acts like a total jerk -- that means he likes you. Sure, that's a lesson that might serve us as five year olds, but many of us keep believing this advice well into adulthood. 
[4]Then, as we get older, we carry on this tradition of misreading the signals men send by encouraging our friends to do the same... 
[5]Why do we say this stuff to each other? Why do we tell each other these lies? 
[6]So, Janine told me you're a real estate agent. 
[7]So just like on frisbees and notepads? 
[8]Much classier. 
[9]I wonder why Janine never thought of introducing us before? 
[10]Only if you do. But I mean, if you have to get going I totally ... 
[11]Well, Conor, I had a really nice time. 
[12]B-bye. 
[13]Hey, it's me. He's cute. I think it went well. 
[14]And I think he might me leaving me a message at home as - we - speak. 
[15]He sells real estate. In Baltimore. Staying in town is his business. 
[16]Really? 
[17]This is all your fault. 
[18]You set me up with him. 
[19]He sold you a house in the ghetto. 
[20]He said he always hangs at Red Maple after work. Maybe I should do a little drive-by? 
[21]Mom, I gotta call you back. 
[22]End.   Why - does it matter? 
[23]Maybe it was at the beginning. 
[24]Or maybe it was at the end.   Or maybe it was nice to meet me. 
[25]Shit.   I can't remember. 
[26]I am so almost done with that. It's just been a little hard to focus on my article about the two sets of twins in market research, when the guy - who may or may not be the guy of my dreams - refuses to call me. 
[27]It's ringing. 
[28]Yes!   Voicemail. 
[29]Hey, Conor. It's Gigi. I just thought, I hadn't heard from you and, I mean how stupid is it that a gal has got to wait for a guy's call anyway, right? 
[30]I mean, we're all equal, right? More than equal -- more women are accepted into law school now than men, and we do better in those police simulations where you can mistakenly shoot innocent people - Dateline - but women practically have penises now, right? Well, call me. This is Gigi. Call me. 
[31]WHAT?   How can there be no dial tone? 
[32]Mom? Is that you? I can't talk now. I'll call you back. 
[33]Janine. It's me. Conor never called, so I'm on the precipice of staging a casual run-in at Red Maple. Pick up if you want to stop me. 
[34]I'm meeting someone.       A guy. 
[35]Hmmmm? 
[36]I'm meeting someone. 
[37]I'm gonna wait at the bar. 
[38]Oh, that's OK. I'm meeting someone. 
[39]I don't know if you'd call it hot -- I mean this guy Conor and I have only been out the one time so -- 
[40]Oh, uhh, yeah -- 
[41]See when I said "meeting someone" I guess that was kind of a broad term, kind of a wide interpretation of the word "meeting"- 
[42]NO! I mean, totally unnecessary. I mean, I actually was just - in the area - so I figured I'd just swing by and see if he was around - because - uhhh --- 
[43]I uhh, had to return his -- 
[44]Pen. I had to return this - pen. He left this. So, I thought I should really return it before he - you know - -- freaks out. 
[45]Look, I'm not gonna judge about what may or may not be important to someone. 
[46]Oh, really?   Then who's his dentist? 
[47]I'm Gigi. Conor and I went out last week. And I just...I thought if I ran into him...I don't know. I'm gonna go. 
[48]Oh really? How do you know? 
[49]He said it was nice meeting me. 
[50]But maybe he called me and I didn't get the message. Or maybe he lost my number, or was out of town, or was hit by a cab, or his grandma died. 
[51]Yeah but my friend Terri once went out with this guy who never called and she totally wrote him off - then like a year later she ran into him -- 
[52]OK.   But what if I'm the exception? 
[53]Really?     Always? 
[54]Why are you telling me all of this? Aren't these man-secrets - like why men need to watch televised golf? 
[55]Thank you. You've given me a lot to think about. 
[56]I was up all night. 
[57]Sure. It's basically done.   But this is important. 
[58]I think I figured it out. Remember when I went out with that notary public? And he cheated on me? And then Anastasia from upstairs told us that story about how her boyfriend cheated on her at the beginning - but then he totally changed and they're married and crazy in love. 
[59]No, notary. Anyway, the point is - Anastasia is the exception. Not the rule. We have to stop listening to these stories - because the rule is that most guys who cheat on you up front don't really care about you very much. 
[60]Exhibit A: Chad, the drummer who lived in his storage space. He only used me for rides, yet I continued to stalk him for most of 1998. Then there was Don, who broke up with me every Friday so he could have his weekends free. I was so delusional about our relationship that I referred to him as my husband to random people like my dental hygenist. 
[61]And all my friends would tell me stories about how things might work out with these dipshits because they knew someone who knew someone who dated a dipshit just like mine, and that girl ended up getting married and living happily ever after. But that's the exception. And we're not the exception - we're the rule. 
[62]No. No, no, no. That's not what I'm saying. This has absolutely nothing to do with you. I was just talking, you know, about me. Specifically. 
[63]You go back to the office after happy hour? What's happy about that? 
[64]Of course. 
[65]So, wait -- how are we doing this? Are you hearing from me or am I getting a call? 
[66]You said you'd love to call me, but then you said "look forward to hearing from you." See how that's kinda confusing? 
[67]Ooopsie - you did it again. Very vague. You know what? Why don't we just say that you'll call me, and then we can skip all the nonsense. 
[68]Or I guess I could just call you -- 
[69]He was cute. 
[70]I'm not calling him.    If he wants to see me - he'll call. 
[71]No.   He was just -- right. 
[72]Hi, this is Gigi. 
[73]Gigi Phillips. I had the - umm - dentist pen. 
[74]I'm really sorry to bug you. I just - I thought you had some really good insights the other night and -- I had a question. 
[75]No, I know. This is about - - Jarrad. You have a sec? 
[76]So I meet him at happy hour and he was completely charming -- 
[77]He may have used some derivative of that. So, he says he's going to call, but then gave me his card and -- 
[78]You don't even know if he called -- 
[79]No. But the thing is, I honestly think he's expecting my call. 
[80]He said "Look forward to hearing from you" and not "Look forward to talking to you." I mean, do you hear the connotations? 
[81]He took mine first, but then he -- 
[82]That's cute.    What happened? 
[83]Is it your sensitivity that makes you so popular with women? 
[84]Again with the sensitivity. 
[85]I know.   Thanks. 
[86]Who would have thought that a random girl from Pilates would fix me up with such a good kisser? 
[87]I can't wait to kiss you again. 
[88]I know. But next time. The second date kiss is way more intimate. 
[89]Would you excuse me a quick second?    Too many diet cokes... 
[90]Hey, sorry to bug you again.   Quick question. 
[91]I'm making out with a guy - PG stuff - and then he mentions he's going out of town, so he's gonna be out of touch. 
[92]But maybe he is going out of town. 
[93]Where are you going out of town to again? 
[94]Pittsburgh. 
[95]So, now what? I'm just supposed to run from every guy who doesn't like me? 
[96]There's not going to be anyone left. 
[97]Yeah? 
[98]So, I'm in his bathroom right now.   What do I now? 
[99]That's OK. I like a little time before a blind date - prepare myself mentally, remind myself not to tell the story about my molars -- 
[100]How can he already not like me? 
[101]Awesome. I'm stuck here with a guy who can't distinguish Tuesday from Thursday - and meanwhile this girl - - she's probably meeting her soul mate as we speak. 
[102]How do you know? 
[103]You cannot tell from a cursory glance that he's not interested. 
[104]Man, you have a gift. 
[105]Maybe there isn't.   You need a spark. 
[106]Really?    Enlighten me. 
[107]I don't. 
[108]Maybe. 
[109]OK.   Yeah. 
[110]That's beautiful. 
[111]Why are you sharing all this inside dating information with me again? 
[112]You do? 
[113]Again with the sensitivity. 
[114]Hello. 
[115]Where am I supposed to be? 
[116]You won't let me go out with guys who don't like me. It's kind of limiting. 
[117]I don't know. Won't Conor be there? Might be kinda awkward. 
[118]So I will have plenty of chances to be awkward. Thank god. 
[119]So, the party - is it like a big party, more of a mellow hang or -- 
[120]He's into me. 
[121]Alex. It's totally clear to me now. He's Watts. 
[122]From Some Kind of Wonderful. 
[123]Yes. 
[124]I'm Eric Stoltz. 
[125]Alex is Watts because Watts helps Eric Stoltz go on a date with Amanda Jones, but really she's in love with Eric Stoltz herself. 
[126]I guess Conor at first. Now men in general. But that's not the point.    The point is -- he's into me. 
[127]I know! It's so obvious now -- there are so many signs. 
[128]At first they were small - like when I first called he said "Good to hear from you" - 
[129]Right? And then the next time I called he was with a woman - but he still took the call. And talked to me for a while. 
[130]He called her "babe." 
[131]I know! And it gets more obvious. I mean, please - there was no guy he was going to fix me up with. The fix up was him. 
[132]He shows up - without this fictitious Bill character - and the two of us basically have a date. And then he calls me to invite me to a party at his place. 
[133]Pardon? 
[134]Thanks for the tip. 
[135]Thanks.   I'm good. 
[136]Gigi.   How do you guys know Alex? 
[137]I hope - I mean I'm pretty sure - something is about to happen between us. 
[138]He didn't really say. 
[139]But I'm sure I'm more than just a guest. I mean - there have been signs. 
[140]Thank you. 
[141]Hey.   Great party. 
[142]They were gay. Even I know that their level of interest was probably low. 
[143]Oh OK.  Right. "Bill". 
[144]You mean, kind of like --- co-hosting? 
[145]Thanks. When Alex said he wanted to have a party, I was like "Let's do it." 
[146]No problem.   Anytime. 
[147]Can I help you find something? 
[148]What? 
[149]When someone's underwear ends up in your toaster oven - it's been a good party. 
[150]That's sweet of you. But I thought I'd stick around, so I'll take care of it. 
[151]I think I've rounded up the last of the beer bottles. 
[152]So, umm - what game is this? 
[153]Well, maybe I should just -- you know -- I mean it's past three and -- 
[154]Is that an invitation? 
[155]I'm sorry. That was cheesy.      I'm not good at this. 
[156]Yes! 
[157]I knew it. I knew it. The best relationships grow out of friendships. 
[158]Ummmm.... 
[159]Well, I'd say if we're not at relationship station--ship, we're at least on the track. 
[160]Because there were - you know - signs. 
[161]Ummm - it was good to hear from me. You talked to me even when you were with a girl. I felt something... 
[162]No. 
[163]I thought you were Watts. 
[164]I'd rather be like that - than like you. 
[165]Maybe I dissect each little thing, and put myself out there too much, and maybe I even thrive on the drama of it all-- but at least that means I still care. You think you've won because women are expendable to you? Sure, you don't get hurt or make an ass of yourself that way, but you don't fall in love that way, either. You haven't won, Alex. You're alone. 
[166]I may do a lot of stupid shit - but I know I'm a lot closer to finding someone than you are. 
[167]Hey Janine, I'm sorry it's so late, but I just - don't start picking out your bridesmaid dress, OK? I know this isn't the first time this has happened, it's just - this one wasn't about whether he liked me. I just really liked him. 
[168]Do you know who it is? 
[169]So are you going to - leave - him? 
[170]It's OK. 
[171]What? 
[172]Janine - this is not your fault. 
[173]You're still fun. 
[174]Lots of couples got through lulls. 
[175]I don't think that's really -- 
[176]What? 
[177]Dino, thank you again for letting me pay over the phone. I assure you this late payment thing will never happen again. Yep -- just trying to trim some of the drama out of my life. 
[178]That's my other line.   OK.     B-bye. 
[179]Hello? 
[180]Ummm - 
[181]Bill.    So you do exist. 
[182]Yes.    Sure.   Why not? 
[183]So, Alex told me you work in finance. 
[184]This is nice. 
[185]A nice evening. And you planned it. And called me when you said you would. And showed up on time. Thank you, Bill. 
[186]Hey it's Gigi. You've reached my cell. I'm either having a very good time or in a meeting - either way just leave a message and -- 
[187]It was nice meeting you. 
[188]You, too. 
[189]Goodnight. 
[190]Did you forget something? 
[191]Really?     What did you forget? 
[192]You came all the way here - at 11 at night - to give me back a promotional pen? 
[193]Sometimes. 
[194]Me. 
[195]Well, a wise person once told me that if a guy wants to be with a girl, he will make it happen. No matter what. 
[196]Hmmm. Because when I was hurling my body onto yours - you did not seem to want to "make it happen." 
[197]Look, I've just been out with your friend Bill. And it just might be exactly what I need. No drama. He calls. He does what he says. 
[198]But you didn't. And that same wise person told me that I am the rule. That I have to stop thinking that every guy will change - stop thinking that I will be the -- 
[199]- that I will be the exception. 
[200]Girls are taught a lot of stuff growing up. If a guy punches you, he likes you. Never try to trim your own bangs. 
[201]And someday you will meet a wonderful guy and get your very own happy ending. 
[202]Every movie we see, every story we're told, implores us to wait for it. The third act twist...the man who couldn't get it together finally figuring it out...the unexpected declaration of love... 
[203]...the exception to the rule. 
[204]How to tell the ones who want us from the ones who don't. The one's who'll stay from the one's who'll leave. 
[205]And ultimately, we're not taught the one thing that could save ourselves, our friends, our families countless hours of confusion, despair, and speculation. 
[206]That sometimes the happy ending...is just moving on.
dialogues.ALEX:
[1]Hey.    How was the date? 
[2]My cable's out. 
[3]Nope. 
[4]How long ago? 
[5]Sorry, dude. 
[6]At 9:30 PM?    Genius. 
[7]Sounds foolproof. 
[8]Hey. 
[9]I know.    I make the schedule. 
[10]Yeah. It's amazing where 10 shots of Patron will get you. 
[11]Look, Kelli Ann - what happened between us the other night was - fun. But we're way understaffed tonight - I even have to man the bar - and that's why I scheduled you. To work. So... 
[12]Are we good here? 
[13]I know. 
[14]What can I get you? 
[15]Oh, yeah?    Got a hot date? 
[16]Wait - Conor Barry? 
[17]Conor's not coming in tonight. Did he forget he was supposed to meet you? 
[18]Because I could just call him -- 
[19]Dr. Frankel - Adult, Child and Geriatric Dentistry. 
[20]That's not even his dentist. 
[21]My dad. 
[22]Hey. Just - hang out for a second. Lemme buy you a drink. 
[23]Look, you seem like a cool girl, so I'm just gonna be honest - Conor is never going to call you. 
[24]Because I'm a guy.   It's how we do it. 
[25]I don't care if he said you were his favorite female since his mommy and Joanie Cunningham. Over a week went by - and he didn't call. 
[26]Or maybe he just didn't call because he has no interest in seeing you again. 
[27]Your friend Terri's an idiot.   And she's the exception. 
[28]You're not. You're the rule. And the rule is - if a guy doesn't call you, he doesn't want to call you. 
[29]Yeah. Always. I know what blowing off a woman looks like. I do it early and I do it often. Trust me - if a guy is treating you like he doesn't give a shit - - he doesn't. No exceptions. 
[30]I don't know. You looked like you could really use the help. 
[31]Gigi? 
[32]Right. 
[33]Okay, maybe I need to be harsh -- Conor is never going to be interested in you. 
[34]Okay... 
[35]Lemme guess - he said the only thing happy about this hour is you. 
[36]He's not interested. 
[37]Did he? 
[38]He.   Is.   Not. Interested. 
[39]If a guy gives you his phone number, instead of taking yours, he's not interested. 
[40]And, if a guy wants to see you, he will see you. I once called 55 Lauren Bell's until I got the right one. 
[41]As it turned out, her ass looked really huge in daylight. 
[42]Don't call him. He doesn't like you. 
[43]Just trying to help. 
[44]Hey dude - you here? 
[45]Wanna beer? 
[46]Or an apple martini? 
[47]Need I ask? 
[48]By pretending you're gay? 
[49]Or, in real estate terms, by becoming "gay adjacent". 
[50]I don't know. You dress like that - and you're already seeing a girl who won't sleep with you - I think maybe you can pull it off. 
[51]Won't sleep with you anymore. 
[52]I think you're gonna have to beat 'em away with a stick - you hot, sexy man. 
[53]Yup. 
[54]Would you excuse me a second, babe? 
[55]Run. 
[56]To where? The Arab Emirates? Where is he going that he has to be out of touch? 
[57]Run. 
[58]Uhh - yeah. 
[59]OK, I don't know why I'm saying this - but I actually think I know a nice guy who you might like. 
[60]Yeah. He's a friend of my brother's. Bill. We'll all meet for a drink - it'll be good. 
[61]You gotta come out eventually. But I'd really take my time. Let him sweat. 
[62]Sorry I'm late. 
[63]He's not coming. 
[64]Can't wait to hear that story about the molars, though. 
[65]I screwed up. I told Bill it was Thursday, but I meant Tuesday. 
[66]Nope. 
[67]See the guy trying to work the Tom Cruise thing. She's interested. He's not. 
[68]Actually, I can. I manage a restaurant. I see this stuff go down every night. Watch -- 
[69]And check out droopy dawg on her other side. He can buy her drinks all night, and she'll insist there's no "spark." 
[70]The "spark" thing is bullshit. 
[71]Guys invented the "spark" so they could not call and treat you kind of bad and keep you guessing, and then convince you that the anxiety and fear that it creates in you is actually a "spark." And you all buy it. You love it. You all thrive on it because you all love drama. 
[72]Really? So you don't wait until the last minute on deadlines, or on phone bills, because you love the drama of not knowing whether you'll make it? 
[73]And let me guess - when you were stalking Conor that night - were you obsessing about him calling for days, even though the date was just kind of mediocre? 
[74]See, you thrive on drama. You gotta be more like me - if a girl likes me great, if not, there are plenty more like her - probably with smaller pores and bigger implants. 
[75]Thanks. 
[76]I dunno.    I like you. 
[77]Don't start doodling my name on your binder. I just mean, I like you, like I like basset hounds. They're kinda pathetic - so you want to cheer them up. 
[78]Oh, hey.     You're home. 
[79]Out.    It's Saturday night. 
[80]I was just calling to let you know - I'm having a party at my place next weekend. You should come. 
[81]He's in DC for the weekend at some real estate conference. But there's gonna be a bunch of single guys. 
[82]Don't worry. I'll be there.      I'll talk you through it. 
[83]Yeah, OK. Gotta go - I think someone just dropped 84 wine glasses. 
[84]I had no idea it would be such a madhouse. 
[85]Are any guys hitting on you? Do you need me to evaluate their level of interest? 
[86]Well - too bad Bill couldn't make it. I still think you guys would hit it off. 
[87]Anyway - I'm on my way to put out some more liquor. But it looks like the food could use some refreshing -- 
[88]Would you mind helping? I mean, just refill the chips and stuff? 
[89]Uhh, OK.   The chips are on top of the fridge. 
[90]I guess people had fun. 
[91]Knock yourselves out. 
[92]You are sensational. 
[93]Thanks for staying and helping clean up - but I really gotta get to bed. 
[94]What? 
[95]Wait - what? 
[96]Now you and I are in a relationship? 
[97]And why would you think that, exactly? 
[98]Really?   Like what? 
[99]What are you talking about? What have I been saying since I met you? If a guy wants to date you HE WILL MAKE IT HAPPEN. 
[100]Why would you do this? 
[101]Why do women do this? Why do they build this stuff up in their minds, take each little thing a guy does and twist it into something else -- 
[102]Excuse me? 
[103]OK - Tyrone you bus 4 through 6 - and pitch in with the servers when you - 
[104]Right.   Luis you take 4 through 6. 
[105]Do we even need to have this meeting? Seriously? Does this serve any purpose? 
[106]Good.   Great. Get to work. 
[107]Hey, Kelli Ann - any calls for me? 
[108]What? 
[109]What has happened to me? 
[110]Who? 
[111]There's no girl. 
[112]Please - 
[113]Shit. 
[114]Hey, Gigi. It's Alex. I was just wondering how you were doing. It's been a little while since we've talked -- and I was wondering how you were doing. 
[115]Anyway, I was hoping to talk to you. Obviously. But you're out. So, call me. Sometime. Or tonight. I'm around. OK. That's enough now. It's Alex. 
[116]I know.   I know. 
[117]Yeah.   I did. 
[118]This. 
[119]I thought I better come up with some excuse to get over here. Isn't that how it's done? 
[120]Look, I can't stop thinking about you. I drive by your place. I call and hang up. I'm turning into - 
[121]Yeah. 
[122]True. 
[123]Here's the thing about that. You were right. I've gotten so used to keeping myself at a safe distance from these women, having the power - that I didn't know what it felt like when I actually - fell - for one of them. 
[124]I could do that stuff too. 
[125]You are my exception.
dialogues.ANNA:
[1]Conor, that's so nice.     Thank you. 
[2]Hmm? 
[3]Hold on. 
[4]You've only got one thing. 
[5]Hey, let me call you right back. 
[6]Come on. Seriously. I just deposited money today. There's no way - 
[7]What? 
[8]Are you kidding? 
[9]I swear to god, this is the most exciting thing that's ever happened to me. 
[10]Is that sad? 
[11]Wait, no. I can't accept this. You were here first. I didn't win at all. 
[12]Thank you SO MUCH. 
[13]Sorry.   What was I saying? 
[14]Was I? Little intense for grocery store chatter. Sorry. 
[15]That would be - amazing.      What are you - like my savior? 
[16]Don't do what? Help struggling singers? 
[17]Do you want to give me your card? That's legit. I bet you're allowed to do that. 
[18]It is impossible not to like this guy. I'm pretty sure he was heavily flirting with me outside Eddie's, and then he tells me he's married. You'd think I'd be pissed, but I literally could not stop myself from liking him. 
[19]I realize that. I keep trying to force myself to picture him in some church saying vows to some woman, and even that doesn't cool it off. What is my problem? 
[20]You're right. I'm calling him. 
[21]Hey, Ben.    This is Anna Marks. 
[22]Well, I was just taking you up on your offer. You said you might know someone who could help me out and I thought we could discuss it -- over coffee? 
[23]Cool. 
[24]Well, you know. I was just thinking about you. 
[25]Your turn. 
[26]There are four. Sexy, smart, funny or cute. And each person can only be two. Like Sarah Jessica Parker is funny and sexy. Or Bill Clinton is sexy and smart. 
[27]So, which am I? 
[28]Smart and cute. 
[29]No. Cute and sexy are in the looks column. No one wants to be in all one column. 
[30]You're the best. 
[31]I better go. 
[32]I know. It's just - I'm fried.    Is that alright? 
[33]It's cool.    You can call me when you find it. 
[34]I know.   But a girl can dream. 
[35]You're obviously too good of a guy. 
[36]Why are you married, again? 
[37]Seriously. Why? It'll be good for me. Tell me how you decided that you could not be without this other woman. 
[38]Seriously?   You just caved? 
[39]Really? 
[40]Mom - you always say that and I always get you something. 
[41]It's no big deal. 
[42]Mom, please - 
[43]Thanks again for coming with me.        You make it so much easier. 
[44]Yeah, well - cool's not always what you're looking for in a mom. 
[45]Ugh. I'm just beat. I wanna put on sweats and get in bed. 
[46]I'll call you tomorrow, OK? 
[47]You came to my class. 
[48]You called and asked me. 
[49]Because you said not to call back if it was my class. Which it was. 
[50]Totally. A couple of innocent folks - by happenstance - doing their daily workout near one another. 
[51]Wanna swim? 
[52]I hear you. Am I supposed to not be friends with a guy just because he's married, and happens to have this insane smile and this ass that makes me want to dry hump? 
[53]Classy, right? 
[54]So, friends, right? 
[55]You wanna come in? 
[56]OK.   You can just watch. 
[57]This is insane. You're like the Liza Minelli of real estate. 
[58]Alright.   Gotta run. 
[59]Uh, no.   Just some stuff.    See you later? 
[60]What? 
[61]What? 
[62]Why stop? 
[63]Stuff like what? 
[64]First of all, I'm not women.   I'm just one. 
[65]I didn't have a second of all. 
[66]Second of all - I can't stop thinking about you, either. 
[67]What? 
[68]I don't want to push you to -- 
[69]You know what's best. 
[70]I'm not picking out china patterns or anything - but I've never felt anything like this before. 
[71]No, he's not leaving his wife for me. He's just - he's a good guy. And he can't really explore what we could be if he's lying to her. 
[72]He's kind of leaving his wife for me. Is this crazy? This is totally crazy. We barely know each other. 
[73]You're totally right.   It can happen. 
[74]Well, what about texter? 
[75]I doubt he has a stoma - 
[76]So don't text. 
[77]That's just mail - 
[78]So what about the singer guy?

[33]The dishes are all put away. There's a load of laundry still drying, but the other one is folded on top of the washer. 
[34]I remembered what your dad likes, but I tried to get healthy stuff, too. 
[35]Ben told me.    I just - I wanted to help. 
[36]I know how much you love him.      But it's gonna be OK. 
[37]Hey. 
[38]Oh no. 
[39]Of course. I really care about your dad. And I really love you. Even if I can't give you what you want. 
[40]And you'd really be OK if we take the marriage thing off the table? 
[41]I always have - 
[42]I do. 
[43]So, I get to move back in? 
[44]What? You're just mad at me, and you're taking it out on the pants. 
[45]OK. We're not getting married, but I'm chucking the pants. 
[46]How did all this stuff fit in here fine before? 
[47]What?    I have no idea what you're - 
[48]That's really gonna free up a lot of space. 
[49]Okay, okay. You win. Just check to make sure there's nothing in the pockets before we give them away. 
[50]I love you so much. So much. I want to make you happy. I need to make you happy for me to even have a shot at being happy, too. 
[51]Will you marry me?
dialogues.MARY:
[1]But he's married. 
[2]OK. There was this guy who worked in my dad's printing business. Married for fifteen years to a nice lady. And then he meets this woman at some church event. And he told my dad he just had never felt anything like it before. I mean, he had finally met the love of his life. So, he divorced his wife, and he's been with this other woman for 22 years and they are blissfully happy. I mean, what if you meet the love of your life - but you already married someone else? Are you supposed to pass them by? 
[3]He asked me out. 
[4]Well - 
[5]Umm - 
[6]He MySpaced me. 
[7]Well, what am I supposed to do? Things have changed. People don't just meet organically anymore. If I want to make myself more attractive to the opposite sex, I don't go get a new haircut - I update my profile. That's just how it is. 
[8]Back to work. 
[9]Ad sales - this is Mary. 
[10]Hey.   So, did you see it? 
[11]You gotta trust me. It's a burgeoning market. You're gonna make a fortune. 
[12]It was either that or on the page with the personals. I made a call. 
[13]This is crazy. I can't believe he's gonna leave his wife for you. 
[14]I don't know.   Remember Becca, my sister's friend. Some guy waits on her at Bennigan's - by the end of the night they both knew they had found the one. 
[15]Not for me. 
[16]Texter has yet to make any verbal contact. I mean, this guy could have had surgery that left him without a voice box, breathing through a stoma, and I'd never know because I never actually hear his voice. 
[17]That's not the point. The point is - I can't text. I'm not charming via text. My sarcasm doesn't come through, I can't type fast enough on the little phone keyboard -- 
[18]It's not just texting. It's email and voicemail and snail mail - 
[19]Whatever. None of it's working. I've had a guy leave a voicemail for me at work, and then I call him back at home, and he emails me to my Blackberry, and then I text him to his cell and then he emails me to my home account from the plane phone -- and it just totally gets out of hand. I miss the days where you had one phone number with one answering machine that housed one cassette tape and either the cassette tape had a message from the guy or it didn't. That's it. Now you have to go around checking all your portals and get rejected by seven different technologies. It's exhausting. 
[20]Jude.    Yeah, I like him. 
[21]Totally.     I felt like we connected. 
[22]There's no way he's already called - we only met for coffee last night. I mean we video iChatted. While holding coffee. Kinda like having coffee. 
[23]And he told me he had a gig last night, so he probably got in real late. Did I tell you he was singer? 
[24]Hey, Conor.    I'm Mary. 
[25]It's so great to finally meet you in person. 
[26]I'd love to.
dialogues.MAYA:
[1]Oh sweetie - you didn't have to get me anything. 
[2]You didn't. 
[3]Here - put on my favorite. 
[4]Did Anna ever tell you I knew Tim Buckley? 
[5]We met at a coffee shop in 1971. Hell's Kitchen. I had no idea who he was. But he had this big mop of hair and these eyes that just looked past you and through you and into you all at the same time. Complete interest and disinterest. It was amazing. 
[6]Of course, I was with Anna's father at the time, so, you know...another opportunity missed. 
[7]It's the truth. I knew them all. Robert Plant, Harry Nilsson, Graham Parsons... Have you seen the pictures of me from when I was Anna's age? 
[8]Sweetie go get that picture - you know the one - 
[9]Go. Your mother's asking you to do something for her on her birthday. 
[10]You'll see - we look strikingly similar. My lips may be a bit fuller, but... 
[11]So that's what we're dealing with here, for reference. Imagine meeting someone who looks like that in a coffee shop. 
[12]That's sweet. But if we're comparing stories - She's no me - and you're no Tim Buckley. 
[13]Anyone need a refill? 
[14]Thanks sweetie. I don't know what I would do without you. 
[15]Baby - what's the matter? 
[16]Is it money? Because you can take back the check if - 
[17]Conor - 
[18]Settle?   Like you think I did? 
[19]Well, your father and I had a glorious life together. 
[20]Those are just dreams Anna. 
[21]Now true - I did not like your father at all when we met. 
[22]Or after we got married for that matter. But let me tell you this - life with him was a hell of a lot better than life is without him. 
[23]There are worse things in life than settling. 
[24]Like wishing you had.
dialogues.KELLI ANN:
[1]Knock knock. 
[2]So.    Here we are. Same shift again. 
[3]I figured it was no coincidence. 
[4]I had fun the other night. 
[5]Anyway - I was thinking, maybe tonight after work...we could, you know... 
[6]No.    We're good. 
[7]Are you joining us for dinner or - 
[8]Ugh.    Why? 
[9]Nothing.   Sorry. For dinner? 
[10]I believe you mentioned that. 
[11]That's a great idea. 
[12]Since you asked me 11 minutes ago?   No, not a lot of phone traffic. 
[13]Oh my god. 
[14]It's happened to you. 
[15]What's her name? 
[16]The girl, Alex. 
[17]You can't hide it man. I know strung out and you are strung - out. 
[18]This is amazing. Can't focus, right? Jumping every time your phone rings, checking your email 100 times a day. Wishing you could write songs. Feeling the need to bring up her name in random conversations... 
[19]It's always the same. And it has happened to you, my friend. Trust me. 
[20]Welcome to my world asshole.
dialogues.NATHAN:
[1]Oh my god!    He called? 
[2]Ouch. 
[3]Just call your voice mail. 
[4]I just got hard. 
[5]It makes your breath stink. 
[6]Chex Mix. I learned the hard way. I made out with a guy after eating like a bag of the stuff. He said my breath smelled like trout. 
[7]I'm sorry. That was rude. And that guy I made out with was a total asshole. 
[8]I'm Nathan.   This is Bruce. 
[9]How do you know Alex? 
[10]So, you're here as like a guest, or like his date? 
[11]Cool. 
[12]Jonathan? 
[13]Dancing.    Get your asses up here.
dialogues.JAVIER:
[1]Yes. 
[2]He's very good. 
[3]Yes. 
[4]I think so. 
[5]Is that the question? 
[6]Oh.    It seemed like a statement. 
[7]I didn't really hear it in the inflection- 
[8]No, ma'am. My guys don't smoke on the job site. They're all good guys. 
[9]I'm pretty sure. 
[10]That's a lot of prepositions... 
[11]Maybe I should just get back to work.
dialogues.CATHERINE:
[1]I do not understand how you got mom to sew all of these in two weeks. 
[2]You're so pregnant. 
[3]Chug a beer, then. I want to see you chug a beer. 
[4]Why didn't you tell us?    You should have told us. 
[5]Why would she want to hang out with us and our husbands? Seriously, Beth, isn't that exactly what you want to avoid right now? 
[6]So not a big deal. You're still really young. 
[7]I knew he was never gonna propose. 
[8]What am I gonna do without dad? 
[9]But he's always been - the one who's there for me. 
[10]Playing ultimate frisbee.    His team may make the quarterfinals.
dialogues.KEN:
[1]OK - that's enough of the speeches. Time to eat. So enjoy the crab. And the yellow stuff is not hot mustard, it's the crab's hepatopancreas. 
[2]Bethie, your cousin Jay has always been a jackass. 
[3]So, you'll get married a little bit later than some people. Big deal. You never did anything the way every one else did it, and that's what I've always thought was so great about you. 
[4]Honey, look. When everyone else was just going to camp at the Y, you borrowed my New York Times, found some arts camp in the Berkshires, wrote away for information, then got accepted on your own. You were nine. You never did things the way everyone else did. 
[5]Because that's you.   That's why you're my favorite daughter. 
[6]Well, I don't give a shit. I'm retired, and I'll say what I want. I'll say it into the mic if you want -- 
[7]It's true, though. 
[8]Yeah. Less of that cardboardy brown stuff. More regular people food. 
[9]Maybe you could just fry me up a couple sausage links? 
[10]Did I tell you that you're not only my favorite daughter, but you're also the prettiest? So much better looking than those other dogs. Seriously.
dialogues.JARRAD:
[1]Well, ladies, I guess I have to get back to the office. 
[2]I met you. 
[3]So, I'd love to call you sometime.    Do you have a card? 
[4]And here's my info. 
[5]Look forward to hearing from you, Gigi. 
[6]What? 
[7]Look - we'll talk. We'll get in touch. 
[8]Goodbye, Gigi.
dialogues.BRUCE:
[1]So? 
[2]What? Did he travel by carriage and leave his calling card with your lady in waiting? 
[3]Just call. 
[4]Amazing.    He'll sing to your babies. 
[5]You want me to smell you?   I'm sure you don't smell like trout. 
[6]We don't. Our friend Mary heard about it from some guy named Conor. 
[7]I hate that - when you don't know if you're a date - so you don't know if you should bring a friend, or if you're like co-hosting or if you should stay til the end to have alone time -- 
[8]I did get a slight waft of trout, though. Take a mint.
dialogues.PAIGE:
[1]She wanted to do it. 
[2]No, she didn't. 
[3]I'm not pregnant. 
[4]We're in love, you assholes. That's what people do when they're in love - they get married. 
[5]Bethie, you know I didn't mean -- 
[6]You know what - if being in the wedding is too painful- 
[7]So young. 
[8]Shit.
dialogues.TALL GIRL:
[1]No, that's OK. I got it. 
[2]Thanks for mixing that up. 
[3]Alex asked me to get the dip together. Thanks for getting it started. 
[4]Hmmm - could use a little more dill. 
[5]Alex, you want me to start cleaning up? 
[6]No.   I got it. 
[7]YES!!    Suck it! 
[8]Did you say it's past three?     Man, I gotta go.
dialogues.LARRY:
[1]It's obvious. She won't sleep with you. It's written all over your puppy dog face. 
[2]Here, have a cookie. 
[3]Honestly - we may not have the best insight. Gay signals have nothing to do with straight signals. 
[4]One, two, three - that's it.   Three seconds or more - it's on. 
[5]One, two - No. Thanks for playing.    Move along. 
[6]But listen - I can tell you this. Gay or straight, you're not going to get anywhere by being inactive. She clearly likes you - maybe she just wants you to be a man and do something. So the next time you're in the position - don't take no for an answer. 
[7]You're right. Let me rephrase.    Don't take maybe for an answer.
dialogues.BILL:
[1]Alex's friend. We were supposed to meet up - but Alex told me the wrong day. 
[2]I do. And I'd love to buy you dinner sometime if you're game. 
[3]Yes.   Yes, I do. Finance. 
[4]It is. 
[5]You're very welcome. 
[6]Thank you for a lovely evening.
